column1: Sortavala (till 1918 Serdobol; Russian: Сортавала; Finnish and Karelian: Sortavala; Swedish: Sordavala) is a town in the Republic of Karelia
column3: located at the northern tip of Lake Ladoga near the Finnish border. Population: 19

column1: The district of Sortavala was first recorded in Swedish documents dating to 1468. Russian documents first mention it as Serdovol or Serdobol in 1500. It was ceded to Sweden after the Ingrian War.

column2: the settlement was joined to Russia along with the rest of Old Finland and was given the Russian name Serdobol. It became known for its marble and granite quarries which provided materials necessary for construction of imperial palaces in St. Petersburg and its neighborhood. In 1812
column3: along with the rest of Viipuri Province
column4: it was joined to the newly formed Grand Duchy of Finland.

column2: the town remained a part of independent Finland. It suffered extensively from mass Soviet bombardment during the Winter War
column3: and through the Moscow Peace Treaty Finland was forced to cede the town to the Soviet Union. All of the population of the town was evacuated for the first time. Like the rest of Finnish Karelia
column4: Sortavala was retaken by Finland during 1941–1944 (the period of the Continuation War) and most evacuees returned to rebuild their homes. However
column6: the Finns were evacuated again and the town was ceded back empty of population. After the war
column7: the town was resettled by the Russian and Karelian population.

column2: the Ladoga shore southwest of Sortavala had been one of the very few relatively densely populated areas north of the Karelian Isthmus populated by Karelians.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column3: together with two urban-type settlements and forty-seven rural localities
column4: incorporated as the town of republic significance of Sortavala—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of republic significance of Sortavala is incorporated as Sortavalsky Municipal District; the town of Sortavala and ten rural localities are incorporated within it as Sortavalskoye Urban Settlement. The remaining urban-type settlements and rural localities are incorporated within the municipal district into two urban settlements and two rural settlements.
